intro: Saxifraga grisebachii f. lindtneri, commonly known as the Lindtner's saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It features dense, mat-forming foliage with broad, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and hardy addition to rock gardens and alpine displays.
